content.p: How to find and access computer rooms on campus. PCs connected to the universityâ€™s data network Usually at least one multi-functional device (MFD) offering colour and mono printing, copying and scanning Wireless access and sometimes specialist audio visual equipment Software applications and more specialist software in some School computer rooms Long opening hours with many computer rooms open 24/7 You will not be able to use computer rooms if they are booked for teaching. You can check room availability on the Timetabling website by selecting the 'Locations' tab. For room bookings and timetables, visit the link below: Timetabling and room booking As well as computer rooms in libraries, individual spaces with PCs are also available in most libraries. Simply drop in to use any available non-booked space or book in advance online using Click and Study. Students can book two three-hour slots per day. Study spaces in libraries Open to all members of the university Access outside core hours is by University Card only It is important that you do not allow unauthorised people to enter computer rooms (i.e. by holding the door open for them when you have used your card to gain access) You must be prepared to identify yourself (with your University Card) to Security staff if necessary Alternatively, the virtual desktop service provides instant access 24/7 to a fully configured virtual university computer. Virtual desktop computer If you're struggling please get in touch with the team Submit and track requests to solve your IT issues Updates on the University's core IT services
